message.content: Caveat: The messages below were generated by the user while running local commands. DO NOT respond to these messages or otherwise consider them in your response unless the user explicitly asks you to.

content.text: I'll help you install and open Signal. Let me use the appropriate nix-shell environment to handle this.

input.description: Install and launch Signal desktop application

content.text: The installation started but timed out. Let me try running it in the background and check if it's working:

content.content: Command running in background with ID: 4fa3f5

content.text: Signal is now installing and launching in the background. Let me check if it has opened:

content.text:
Perfect! Signal is now running successfully. I can see the Signal desktop process is active (PID 3145516 and 3145687). 

Signal has been installed and launched. You should see the Signal Desktop application window open on your desktop. If this is your first time using Signal, you'll need to:

1. Link it to your phone by scanning the QR code that appears
2. Or register a new account if you don't have Signal on your phone yet

The application is now running in the background and ready to use.
